How do I use the `sendcurrency` command to park a conversion of VRSCTEST to a new token before it launches, and what are the possible outcomes after the token launches?

To park a conversion of VRSCTEST to a new token before it launches, you can use the `sendcurrency` command. The format of the command is:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"your_address@","convertto":"new_token","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
This command effectively parks your conversion until the new token launches. After the token launches, you will either find the converted amount of the new token in your wallet, or you will have your original VRSCTEST amount returned.

In this specific example, the command is parking a conversion of 100 VRSCTEST to a new token called GOLD. If the GOLD token launches, you will either find 0.975 GOLD in your wallet, or you will have your 100 VRSCTEST back.

It's also worth noting that after the GOLD token launches, you can create a new token called mycoin, which can be converted to using either GOLD or VRSCTEST. This demonstrates the flexibility and interoperability of the Verus ecosystem, allowing for the creation of new tokens and currencies that can be easily converted and exchanged with one another.

ST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
